column1: Lactic acid is mainly produced in muscle cells and red blood cells.
Times when your body's oxygen level might drop include: - During intense exercise - When you have an infection or disease A test can be done to measure the amount of lactic acid in the blood.
Most of the time blood is drawn from a vein located on the inside of the elbow or the back of the hand.

Conditions that can increase lactic acid levels include: - Heart failure - Liver disease - Lung disease - Not enough blood containing oxygen getting to a certain area of the body - Severe infection that affects the entire body (sepsis) - Very low levels of oxygen in the blood (hypoxia)
